derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from French dynastie, or via late Latin from Greek dunasteia 'lordship, power', from dunastēs (see dynast)

entry.def: A dynasty is a series of rulers of a country who all belong to the same family.

example.ex: The Seljuk dynasty of Syria was founded in 1094.
example.tran: 叙利亚的塞尔柱王朝始建于 1094 年。

entry.def: A dynasty is a period of time during which a country is ruled by members of the same family.

example.ex: ...carvings dating back to the Ming dynasty.
example.tran: 可以追溯到明朝的雕刻

entry.tran: 王朝(指同一家族在某领域，如政界或商界，有两代以上的重要领袖或权威人物)
entry.def: A dynasty is a family which has members from two or more generations who are important in a particular field of activity, for example in business or politics.

means.word_mean: 1. a sequence of powerful leaders in the same family

stems_affixes.word_buile: dynast[n.君主, 统治者]+y→n.王朝,朝代

sentences.en: The dynasty he founded ruled for 700 years.
sentences.cn: 他建立的那个王朝统治达700年。

sentences.en: Colonization took place during the Habsburg dynasty.
sentences.cn: 开拓殖民地在哈布斯堡王朝就进行过。

means.word_mean: （控制权力达几代人的）家族或集团

sentences.en: The Daley family is a Chicago political dynasty.
